text: A bit more approachable than Ellas Ice. Very solid, golden pour, crazy amount of legs. Sweet apple aroma and taste, slightly tart. sticky mouthfeel. Ended up going back for another bottle.

2010 vintage from the farm winery. Clear concentrated golden pour with nice legs. Concentrated and sweet apple, nice tartness and tang on the finish. Long apple finish with some skin and a wonderful farm finish. Unexpected and delicious.

Deep amber-gold pour. The nose is laden with honey-glazed fruit, soft
spice and a bit of acidity. Some light tartness and a bit of cooked
fruit character. Theres a little bit of light fruit and some apricot
notes as well. Chewy, sweet yet well balanced by tartness. Lovely.

Sample [2010]
Pours light brown with no head. No serious legs. Aroma is of apples, alcohol, pears. Taste is of apples, pears, sugar, alcohol, some acidity. Palate: Full bodied. Sticky. No carbonation. Some warming alcohol. Overall: Very good. Deep and complex. Sweet apples.

Sample shared. Reddish copper pour, quite clear, pretty pour. Aroma is intensely fruity, tons of strawberry, lots and lots of berries, light spicy apple pie, cinnamon like aroma. Taste is fruity, nice strawberry flavor, very sweet, rich and desserty, apple pie. Palate is full bodied, mouth coating. Very very nice.

2010 Vintage, bottle from the winery. Dark copper pour, long legs on the glass. Aroma is super sweet apples of course, with big notes of caramel, and some subtle spice. Mouth feel is heavy and luscious, and oily. Finish is satisfying, and is an incredible sipper. Sweet, but manages to not be cloying, with some nice soft spice. Amazing stuff.

2010 vintage. Pours a clear copper with nice legs. Nose is of apples, cloves, pears, brown sugar and some alcohol. More complexity than your average ice cider. Taste is sweet with lots of caramel and brown sugar with some brown apples flavors. Body is full and mouthfeel syrupy, like some apple drizzle really. Just a touch hot. Overall a really nice dessert, different!

Tasting at Matts, vintage 2010, 5 years oldDark amber color, bright, thick. Strong nose of caramelized pineapple. Thick mouthfeel, a bit too syrupy; the flavor brings a lot of stewed apples, prunes, raisins, concentrated pineapple; correct acidity, but less than other Ice Ciders from Quebec. The alcohol is well hidden.Excellent.

2010 vintage sample. clear amber reddish, pink tint, with some legs. loads of raspberries and strawberries (!), baked apples, lightly tart red apples, toffee apple sweetness - never cloying, raspberry seeds, spices. flat carbonation, medium-full body - syrupy; very lightly tart, astringent, sweet and fruity-spicy finish. singular raspberry-apple pie flavours. very good stuff!

2 oz sample from bottle (375 ml). 2010 harvest. From SlovakSniper, thanks!

Appearance: Clear bright orangey-copper with nice alcohol legs. 

Aroma: More caramel than apples forward, but theres still some caramelized apples of course as well as mild spiciness (cinnamon mostly), hints of vanilla and floral notes. 

Taste: Medium to heavy sweetness with loads of caramel and caramelized apples, moderate acidity, mild spiciness, vanilla notes, a bit of alcohol and honeyed notes.

Palate: Medium to full body. Oily and syrupy mouthfeel. Warming finish with mild spiciness. Mouth coating caramelized apples. 

Overall: Extremely well balanced ice cider with a unique profile. Nice mix between caramel (not brown sugar like many ice ciders) and other components. Very tasty stuff.

Vintage 2010. La robe est celle dun cognac ou dune eau-de-vie similaire. Le nez est riche en caramel, en miel, en poire fraîche, en pomme compotées et en fleurs acidulées. Le goût étonne avec cet équilibre entre les sucres et lacidité. Cest franchement très bon. La belle texture soyeuse va de pair avec son corps assez fort. Sa finale est profonde, mielleuse avec une touche dérable et remplie par les fruits. Complexe. Excellent.

2010 vintage. 375mL bottle, pours a pretty clear brandy-like caramel colour. Nose is luxurious, with loads of caramel apple sweetness, pineapple and a subtle tartness underneath. Flavour is similar, with caramelized apple and pineapple sweetness (unusual that this is so pineapple-y), with medium-high sweetness for an ice cider, and absolutely no tartness. Really viscous palate, with a lovely mix of fruits that is unusual for an ice cider. Very decadent stuff. Fantastic, unique one.

Bottle 375ml. corked. [ As Applewood Farm Iced Cider ].Clear medium yellow - amber orange color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy apple, sweet apple, apple syrup, alcohol, strawberry. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, intense apple and strawberry, sweet apple, tart - acidic apples. Body is medium, texture is syrupy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20140805]

Bottle shared by b3shine. Poured dark pale color with a minimal head that diminished quickly with excellent legs. Heavy sweet dark apple and soft alcohol aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth texture and solid legs. Solid flavor of dark apple with a medium to heavy complex sweet finish with a warming alcohol burn of moderate to long duration. Good after dinner sipper with a good cigar.

Tall thin 375 ml bottle shared by b3shine on his return to Cincy. Pours a clearhhoney amber color with no head. The aroma and flavor have big apple cider character, vanilla, some spices, viscous and sticky, sweet but not in a bad way, pretty tasty, this would make for a nice sipper as the nights start turning colder.

375 ml bottle to snifter (2010 vintage,shared with the Cincinnati crew). Looks good; a still and fairly transparent pale burnt orange. Smells solid; sweet concentrated apples and a bit of vanilla and a hint of earthiness. Tastes like it smells with a full and slick but smooth mouthfeel. A good, complex ice cider.
Bottle - Vintage 2010 - Apple, tannins and dark skins. Rich bronze and oily. Sweet apples, tannins and a long finish. Pretty good for the price.
2010 edition is 80% russet plus 5 other apples.  Delicious, but may be closer to apple wine for dedicated ice cider palates.

pours a honey orange. Nose is of apples, vanilaa, spice. This my first experience with the style, I found it to be a very well balanced sweet, spicy, tart, thick, dessert drink. I was impressed to be certain!

GRB 4th anniversary tasting. Pour golden yellow. Aroma stone fruits, apples, spice, hint of sweetness. Taste terrific balance of mild spice, apples, sweetness, and acidity. MF thick and coating. Wow what a terrific cider very well done and best ice cider Ive had to date cheers!!

multiple samples at Grand River Brewings 4 th Anniversary party. clear deep yellow, sexy legs. huge apricot and peach aroma. very well integrated acidity helps this from being cloying. amazing ice cider, i can see why it won canadian ice cider of the year in 2010.Earlier Rating: 2/17/2008 Total Score: 4.32006 vintage. pours light amber with no head. huge legs all over the glass after a quick oxidizing swirl. aromas are apple pie spice with a lingering sweet fruitiness. flavours are complex waves of apple and spices. thick, sweet apple yumminess. full bodied with a sticky mouthfeel. a touch too sweet but overall very enjoyable. Ill be placing another order soon Applewood!

500 ml bottle- Deep rusty gold, almost amber. Pours still but the swirl produces some nice legs. Looks quite oily. On the nose, fresh robust apples, some spices, vanilla,caramel, a bit of alcohol......strangely almost earthy. Tastes of fresh apple cider, red delicious and honey crisp, a bit of spicy floral like flavour comes through with caramel and brown sugar. Quite sweet. A full bodied, and quite boozey example of a fantastic style of cider. This is exceptional, though I suggest a small serving.

Thanks Mc backus, 
My First experience with iced ciders and man it was wonderfull reminded me of the fall in ohio nice and crisp apple aromas with the sweetness of the scent of falling leaves just reminds me so much of the fall with the intense flavours and aromas..

bottle from matt7125: pours a nice honey colour with no head and some oily legs onthe glass. aroma is a great sweet honey mixed with fresh apple juice, slight apple peel aroma mixed with some flowers. very nice. flavour is a very sweet apple juice with a big sticky mouth feel that is very welcomed. a touch of floralness flows in then a great honey profile. this is very good not just apple is in this but a great array of flavour and aromas. great honeynees

[1386-20080524] 500mL bottle. Wine-like apple aroma has a bit of wood and apple butterscotch. Clear, amber orange body has no head but nice legs. Sweet sugar flavour is mostly woody apples and butterscotch. Medium body is sweet. Could pass for 15% easily, very pleasant.
(c/o HogTownHarry, w/ others)
Overheard: "I poured water in it and it’s still 5%."

Bottle (500ml) shared at Biegamans Second Annual Saison Tasting -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. 2006 vintage. Vibrant reddish-gold colour, very still body. Aroma is warm and boozy with notes of sweet apple and butterscotch. Medium bodied, a bit sticky. Flavour is rich and very, very warm, with lots of apple and caramel - its like an alcoholic candy apple! Would be nicer if the booze was brought down a bit, but otherwise, a really enjoyable tipple.

Bottle (500ml) shared at Biegamans Second Annual Saison Tasting -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. 2006 vintage.Pours a clear oily orange with no head. Aroma of booze and sweet apples, butterscotch and vanilla -- nice and pleasant. Flavour: Whoa Nelly! Quite tasty but man thats strong! Booze and sweet apples. Sticky, oily mouthfeel, full bodied. Quite good in small samples -- pretty tasty stuff.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 2015-05-30. Golden amber body with a syrupy body. Aroma is quite sweet and fruity, notes of apples, sugar. Flavour is similar, sweetly sugary, fruity apple character and notes of skins. Bit too sweet overall, it has lower acidity than some other ice ciders which leaves it less balanced. Smooth full bodied syrupy palate, no carbonation. 4+ Enjoyable. 7-8/4/7-8/4/15-16
Bottle from Applewood.

2005-05-24. Rich golden caramel coloured body with a thick syrupy body that coats the glass. (3+) Sweet buttery butterscotch notes in the aroma, fairly alcoholic overtones, surprisingly not a lot of apple actually. Flavour is similarly sweet, caramel like sugars, sugary apples, very light tart apple in the background, bitter apple skins, dry alcohol and apple skins in the finish. Syrupy full bodied palate. Pretty decent but I just liked, not loved it. 7/4/7/4/15 2006 Vintage, Bottle shared by HogTownHarry

Bottle (500ml corked & clear).  At 2nd Annual Summer Saison Tasting - my  bottle via trade with Matt7215.  Amber-tinged gold pour, slick and oily-looking, solid legs.  Moderately boozy aroma (but NOT 22%!), rich blend of buttery malt and overripe apple, hint of white wine.  the taste initially has very strong alcohol (more than one "whoooooooooooo!:" was heard) but it settles down to a sweet, strong experience rather like a carnival candy apple liqueur.  Thick, alcoholic, slightly burnt taste, the apple really comes out in the finish - well done - quite a different take on the Québec-style ice ciders, but really good.

Sampled at Jans Saison tasting! With thanks to HogTownHarry for supplying the bottle. Appearance: Brown with nice legs zero head, still, zero carbonation. Aroma: Burnt over ripe apples, alcohol - port. Flavour: Liquer, sticky honey, some apples, hot alcohol burn! Like a nice dessert liquer

Thanks to thecheeseman, dan youre definitely helping me develop and love of ciders!  Dried apples, apple skins, some alcohol, with hints of grass in the aroma.  Pours light gold, apple juice.  INTENSE apple flavor, thick, tart apples, apple skins, alcohol is well hidden, big big flavor.  Its very warming, with a slight musty flavor with hints of apricots.  Great!
